intro: Pedicularis coreana, commonly known as the Korean lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Korea. It belongs to the genus Pedicularis, which includes about 200 species of flowering plants, many of which are found in the Northern Hemisphere. The plant is characterized by its tall, branched stems and clusters of small, often reddish or purple flowers. It typically grows in alpine or subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained, rocky soils. Pedicularis coreana is a perennial herb that blooms in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
